body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Stories     The Creation of a National Park     Administrative Histories                  Administrative Histories         Park historian Ralph Happel interviews Phenie Tapp in 1937 NPS Image     The park's first administrative history was written by park employee Ralph Happel in 1955. It covers the history of the park until that point, including the land before the Civil War, early battlefield development, and changes made by the War Department and the National Park Service in the 1920s and 1930s.   Download a PDF of Happel's administrative history   Â      NPS Employee stands on the Sunken Road, where a rehabilitated landscape is threatened by modern encroachments, such as the houses in the background NPS Photo   The most recent park administrative history, entitled At the Crossroads of Preservation and Development: A History of Fredericksburg & Spotsylvania National Military Park (2011), was written by contracted historian Joan M. Zenzen. This work builds on Happel's history as well as covering the pivotal eras of battlefield development after 1955. It offers an excellent analysis of the park on the eve of the 150th anniversary of the Civil War.   Download a PDF of Zenzen's administrative history
